shredder 0.1.0

Working With brms

Source: vignettes/brms.Rmd
brms.Rmd
library(shredder)
library(brms)

Generate Data

group <- rep(c("treat", "placebo"), 
             each = 30)

symptom_post <- c(
  rnorm(30, mean = 1, sd = 2), 
  rnorm(30, mean = 0, sd = 1)
)

dat1 <- data.frame(group, symptom_post)

Run Model

fit <- brm(bf(symptom_post ~ group, sigma ~ group), 
           data = dat1, 
           family = gaussian())
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 2000; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 4000

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept         0.28047   0.18874 -0.09950  0.64726 1.00000     4948     3203
sigma_Intercept   0.02888   0.13461 -0.21728  0.29310 1.00303     3634     2427
grouptreat        0.92949   0.39840  0.13266  1.71248 1.00038     2969     2380
sigma_grouptreat  0.60973   0.18844  0.24811  0.98708 1.00052     3358     2642

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Eff.Sample 
is a crude measure of effective sample size, and Rhat is the potential 
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Select first 100 Posterior Samples from each Chain

fit_slice <- fit%>%stan_slice(1:100)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 1100; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 400

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept         0.27293   0.19240 -0.13278  0.63153 0.99983      542      283
sigma_Intercept   0.02866   0.13558 -0.21214  0.29954 1.01874      263      191
grouptreat        0.94252   0.40920  0.13264  1.75582 1.00347      338      204
sigma_grouptreat  0.61126   0.18288  0.27369  0.94435 1.00818      250      295

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Eff.Sample 
is a crude measure of effective sample size, and Rhat is the potential 
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_slice%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Sample 25% of Posterior Samples from each Chain

fit_sample <- fit%>%
  stan_sample_frac(0.25)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 1250; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 1000

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept         0.28282   0.18704 -0.09777  0.65744 0.99837      994      913
sigma_Intercept   0.02899   0.13502 -0.20634  0.28927 1.00224     1047      993
grouptreat        0.93516   0.40045  0.14409  1.69796 1.00180     1081      991
sigma_grouptreat  0.61271   0.18347  0.26250  0.96756 1.00238      921      952

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Eff.Sample 
is a crude measure of effective sample size, and Rhat is the potential 
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_sample%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Filter Posterior Samples by Conditional

fit_filter <- fit%>%
  stan_filter(b_grouptreat>=2)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 3 chains, each with iter = 1004; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 12

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept        -0.13283   0.20123 -0.44069  0.22150 1.03030       12       12
sigma_Intercept   0.09674   0.09420 -0.07153  0.20830 1.51506       12       12
grouptreat        2.11402   0.12413  2.00594  2.38735 1.00478       12       12
sigma_grouptreat  0.61756   0.13492  0.37641  0.83507 1.08364       12       12

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Eff.Sample 
is a crude measure of effective sample size, and Rhat is the potential 
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_filter%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Filter Posterior Samples by Conditional Subset Chain

fit_filter_chain <- fit%>%
  stan_filter(b_grouptreat>=2)%>%
  stan_retain(chains = 1)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 1 chains, each with iter = 1004; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 4

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept        -0.07052   0.11807 -0.13304  0.08925 1.90251        4        4
sigma_Intercept   0.13052   0.08742  0.01706  0.20771 1.90251        4        4
grouptreat        2.05595   0.03077  2.02099  2.09092 0.90585        4        4
sigma_grouptreat  0.62858   0.03706  0.58582  0.66992 2.49796        4        4

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Eff.Sample 
is a crude measure of effective sample size, and Rhat is the potential 
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_filter_chain%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)
